name: Dinner Tonight: Cold Sesame Noodles with Kimchi
description: The first time I tried kimchi, a spicy Korean concoction of fermented vegetables, a friend of mine had made a stew out of it for a group of friends. The hot, vinegary taste flavored the whole broth, which had tofu...
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound dried somen or udon (Japanese wheat noodles)
1 tablespoon kimchi juice from the jar, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a pot of water to boil and boil the noodles according to package directions, 7 minutes in my case. Drain the cooked noodles and run under cold water until cool.
2. In the meantime, chop the kimchi and combine it in a bowl with the sugar, vinegar, and kimchi juice. Add the cooked noodles and the sesame oil, and toss to combine.
Season to taste with salt (kimchi is already quite salty) and top with scallions.
